Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with healthy leaves and stems when it has enough water.
The student can draw a plant with droopy or brown leaves and stems when it does not have enough water.
The student can depict sunlight in their drawings to show that plants need light alongside water to live and grow.
The student can illustrate and label a scene where plants in a dry area look different compared to those in a watered area.
The student can show patterns by including several plants demonstrating the effect of having or not having water.
The student can label their drawing to explain how water affects plant growth.
